summary: This bill, the "Just Incarceration of Criminal Elements in D.C. Act" (JUSTICE in D.C. Act), introduced in the U.S. Senate, aims to repeal the District of Columbia Incarceration Reduction Amendment Act and Second Look Amendment Act. It also mandates the Office of Victim Services and Justice Grants to issue annual grants, starting in fiscal year 2026, up to $200,000 per grant, to organizations providing services to survivors of violent crimes. The bill was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
